timeline.message: removed braces from single variable lambdas

timeline.bodyText: I think i liked the multi-line version here - it's too long to easily read.
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.bodyText: Ditto here (although the line below is also stupidly long).
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.bodyText: Is the stream redundant here given forEach is used right after? I noticed this all throughout this PR - would you mind searching for instances of stream().forEach(...) and correcting that?
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText: The forEach function used is for the stream object. Removing the stream call will result in this instance (and I suspect others) in using the Iterable version. Do you know if they have similar implementations? If they don't, it may be worthwhile leaving as is
replies.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText: You are correct, and from what I've read it shouldn't make too much difference which one you use for most cases. That being said, unless you're following up with streaming operations, the Iterable version does seem a little more flexible in that it has order, respects data locks and allows premature returns. @arcturus2 - what do you think?
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText:
@cygnus-x-1 based on what I've read a stream is less memory intensive that an iterator which writes to the heap more often (for the reasons you have described - the extra checks it does).
I'd like to get into using streams more so I'd favor to leave it as is.
replies.author: arcturus2

replies.bodyText: Ok I think I'll leave it as is then. We can address this at a later date if we do decide we want to go down a different path
replies.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText: @arcturus from what i've read the memory and time improvements only really apply when streaming over large datasets. For a Lookup as above, where you would expect no more than 10's of results, streams can actually have a higher time and possibly even memory overhead due to the additional objects created by the stream. We should revisit this later...
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText: ok @cygnus-x-1 worth fleshing out more sometime.
replies.author: arcturus2

timeline.bodyText: Could you expand the single character variable names here?
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1
